The forum isn't as good as Twitter for sharing small bits of information for the same reason Neil deGrasse Tyson doesn't make a video or a news article whenever he has an odd thought.

I suppose maybe if the Announcements forum had it's own thread where twitter posts could be posted by mods or something, but really I do think Twitter is better!

That's great news, ROUND8 LFO is here to stay! I'm happy Squad listened, though a discussion beforehand would've been great (and would've saved time/effort on Squad's side blood pressure-related issues of some KSP players)!!!

> 
> Is it seriously so bad to call the next update 1.0 that you refuse to do so? Do you despise compromise and related concepts? ...**snip**...

I'm using [Squad's own interpretation](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/313-Beta-Than-Ever-The-Future-of-KSP) for version/development naming conventions. They are still in the process of laying the groundwork for some big systems (ISRU, re-entry heat), so by their own definition they're in alpha -> 0.27 for the next update. I'm a great advocate of compromise, however, if there's no discussion how can there be compromise? The community [expressed their concern en masse](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/108318-Do-you-feel-KSP-is-ready-for-1-0) about KSP going gold, but all we got was 'we're uncomfortable being in Early Access' so 'the next update will be our 1.0 release', followed by a excessive amount of silence on the matter.

IMHO, as a former marketing guy, I think the real problem is that Squad doesn't know how social media works and how they're supposed to use it to drive users to a single point of primary contact. There should be, when you click on the forums button, a twitter feed on the right hand side with Maxmaps' latest tweets as they happen. Posts on Reddit should be links to full articles/full responses here. Tumblr gets used more often than their own blog feature here. Official Squadcasts should be nested, archived and easily accessible from right here.

The fact that this is not the case is an example of Squad failing to comprehend how new media works.

Now, this is not the failure of Squad as a whole, but rather a succession of failures by previous community managers (and whoever gave those managers their marching orders) who were great at interaction, but clueless as to what they're supposed to be doing. Marketing through new media is about creating networks of consumers and guiding them to a single source to *build a community*. Kerbalspaceprogram.com is supposed to be ***the*** place to go for news and discussions about KSP.

Yet it isn't.

IMHO, it is telling that in order to get the full picture of a feature being implemented or interacting with developers that one must scour multiple forums and mediums outside of this site. In fact, it is the second largest single major contributing factor to their continuing PR blunders and ineptitude at managing their community. They're sitting on a powder keg and don't even know it. They're clueless because their primary focus is on everywhere *but* here. It isn't malicious... Squad simply takes their own forums for granted and relies on their very capable moderators to avert catastrophe while they delude themselves that focusing elsewhere is good for business.

The ludicrous speculation and mania regarding fairings, or the new aero, or any of the other new features that are *hyped but not expanded upon* - which is ultimately the source of all the rampant speculation, mass hysteria, irrational criticasting and ridiculous conclusions we routinely see on this site - are symptoms of the fact that Squad's PR and marketing energies and focus is elsewhere. Hell, our own moderators have to hunt down hi rez images and repost them, whereas the low rez should be posted elsewhere with a link to the high rez images originally posted on this site.

Drive the traffic here, not away.

Duh.

Anyways, I think I've written everything I'm going to write on the matter, and leave it at that.

Cheers!

Clipping has always allowed you to bury things but it's never affected anything, even in FAR. Like you said we'll have to wait and see what the new model does.

> 
> Clipping has always allowed you to bury things but it's never affected anything, even in FAR. Like you said we'll have to wait and see what the new model does.

Im guessing that they arent going to do a 100% dynamic aero model, as it actually takes alot of processing power to pull something like this off. Id guess that there might be so called part occlusion (say you place a fuel tank behind a nose cone, only the nose cone is considered to exert any drag), so id guess clipped pats could act as if they were hidden behind something else. Still, until release, we can only speculate, hopefully wing effects on other wings and parts blocking wings arent modeled, but if they are RIP sci-fi replicas, as most of them NEED wings/surfaces/ect clipped inside to function at all.

The one surefire way to cancel drag (that im aware of) is clipping stuff into one of those utility or cargo bays, as thatll flag them as shielded and they shouldnt be affected or even checked by the aero model untill you open said bay. Im actually tempted to make a reentry aircraft that has wings inside one of those utility bays, is capable of reentrying on its own,
